text:
Kamis, 16 Mar 17 saya dan istri memutuskan untuk menghabiskan waktu berlibur di villa yang 'katanya' sangat spektakuler ini, awal kedatangan disambut baik oleh staf, kami menyewa villa nomor 3 lalu ketika kami ditinggal berdua, bencana pun terjadi satu persatu :
1. Akses wi-fi sangat jelek, saya terpaksa memakai aktifitas internet menggunakan sinyal seluler sendiri selama berada disana
2. Tirai penutup kamar yang berada di lantai paling atas rusak dan kami tidak bisa membuka lebar padahal kami ingin memanfaatkan momen berfoto dengan view laut tapi terhalang oleh tirai
3. Jacuzzi nya rusak dan diperbaiki pada saat kami memberitahukan, yang jadi masalah kenapa pihak villa tidak mengecek sebelum ada tamu yang datang
4. Tombol lampu yang katanya smart villa ini nyatanya banyak yang tidak berfungsi DAN lagi-lagi kami memanggil teknisi untuk memperbaiki DAN sekali lagi kenapa mereka tidak mengecek sebelumnya
5. Payung dipinggir kolam rusak dan terpaksa saya yang harus membuka sendiri serta memperbaiki sendiri agar view pada saat difoto jadi bagus
6. Obor yang mestinya dapat kami manfaatkan didekat tebing ternyata rusak dan alasan pihak villa itu sudah lama rusak, WOW sungguh alasan yang sangat bijak untuk villa dengan harga sewa yang lumayan ini
7. Pintu kamar mandi yang berada di lantai paling bawah juga tidak bisa tertutup rapat
8. Bangunan nya juga banyak yang sudah rusak, kotor, berlumut, terkesan tidak dirawat
Kesimpulan : untuk harga sewa yang jutaan dengan mendapat fasilitas seperti ini saya JANJI tidak akan mau datang kesini lagi, masih banyak villa yang harga nya dibawah namun lebih bagus
title: Bulan madu yg 'mengecewakan'

text: kamar sangat nyaman,ruangan cukup luas dan sudah di lengkapi teknologi modern menggunakan digital di semua ruangan dari mulai kamar mandi sampai ruang tamu,lokasi sangat strategis di daerah seminyak dan tidak sulit untuk mencari makanan atau cafe,fasilitas dan pelayanan cukup baik

text:
Jika Anda mencari kamar yang agak mewah untuk liburan, maka coba pertimbangkan C151.

Kolam pribadi. Hebat.
Akomodasi dan perabotan. Hebat.
Staf. Hebat.
Sarapan. Bagus.
Transportasi. Hebat.
Lokasi. Hebat.
Kenyamanan. Sudah Pasti!

Apabila ada hal yang perlu ditingkatkan - lebih baik jangan memakai kopi instan dan pasang mesin pembuat kopi. Sudah banyak lokasi yang kualitasnya lebih rendah memasang mesin pembuat kopi Nespresso atau Illi.
title: Akomodasi yang hebat di jantung Seminyak.

text: Memesan 2 - villa kamar tidur melalui hotels.com selama 2 malam. Karena beberapa gerakan personil tak terduga, kami membuat pemesanan tiga kali, dan dua kali dibatalkan. Ketika kami tiba di pagi hari, kami ngeri, kami diberitahu oleh manajer penjualan asisten bahwa ada tidak lebih 2 - kamar tidur villas. Rupanya ada beberapa miskomunikasi antara hotels.com dan C151. Kami sangat tegas dalam meminta dia untuk memberi kita ruang karena kita dibayar penuh, dan jelas kita tidak ingin tidur di jalanan tanpa tempat tinggal! Dia terganggu dan setuju untuk memberi kami 3 - kamar tidur vila (dengan 3 kamar terkunci) pada hari 1, dan villa presiden hari ke-2. Kedua Vila-vila yang dari desain yang sama, tetapi villa presiden memiliki taman yang lebih besar, dan outdoor jacuzzi. Kelemahan dari villa ini adalah bahwa ada banyak barang kecil yang tidak bekerja - monitor dari sistem keamanan, keran di toilet tertentu cukup sulit untuk menyalakan, layar LCD dari jacuzzi dalam ruangan tidak bekerja, dan kontrol volume dari speaker yang berbeda yang tidak akurat. Kekecewaan besar adalah ketika brosur mereka menyatakan layanan spa akan tersedia 10:00-08:00 setiap hari, kita benar-benar mengambil bahwa dalam dan berpikir satu-satunya kali kita tidak bisa memiliki pijat adalah 08:00-10:00, dan dipanggil untuk pijat di 8 + pm pada hari terakhir, dan diberitahu bahwa pijat adalah 10:00-20:00. Namun, itu masih tinggal yang menyenangkan untuk us.24h butler service adalah plus besar, dan makanan memerintahkan melalui layanan kamar terjangkau, lezat dan baik didirikan oleh Butler kami. Jika Anda sedang mencari transportasi ke beberapa toko-toko terdekat, Anda dapat meminta kereta untuk menjemput Anda di sana. Sistem suara terhubung ke seluruh villa, dan Anda dapat memutar CD yang disediakan oleh villa
title: Villa smart luas, tapi tidak semuanya bekerja

photos.caption: Breakfast served to your dining table

text: Villa C151 benar-benar luas dan sangat mewah. Lokasinya sangat dekat dengan pantai, restoran yang bagus, serta bar seperti di Seminyak. Bahkan ada pasar di samping, juga sebuah restoran kecil yang bagus - Sate Bali yang mengadakan kursus memasak dan sangat cocok untuk sajian yang dibawa pulang jika kita tidak ingin meninggalkan villa. karena kami sangat terpesona dengan kamarnya, kami tidak terlalu memperhatikan demonstrasi teknologi yang seharusnya kami miliki dan membuat kami terlepas beberapa kali - seperti tidak bisa membuka tirai atau tidak bisa mematikan lampu sepenuhnya - stafnya sangat bersedia membantu, tetapi tip dari saya adalah memberikan perhatian (jika anda bisa) kami memiliki villa dengan 2 kamar tidur dengan 2 X tempat tidur King size, 2 kamar mandi marmer besar dan satu kamar mandi marmer yang lebih kecil (tetpai cukup besar). Ditambah kolam pribadi 15 meter, area dapur/bersantai yang luas dan ruangan media yang terpisah. Banyak tempat - harganya terjangkau, sarapannya hebat - stafnya ramah dan suka menolong. Satu-satunya masukan dari saya hanya pilihan kombinasi menu dapat disederhanakan untuk memenuhi berbagai selera - namun tetap, ini hal yang sangat menyenangkan.
title: Melebihi apa yang diharapkan

text: My family of 4 adults & 1 baby took the 2 bedroom villa for this trip. The actual villa is as per the photos that I saw on the website - spacious, clean looking & comfy like home. We liked the 2 big bedrooms with 2 connecting extra big indoor bathrooms. The indoor bathrooms were truly important for us as we were mostly attacked by the armies of mosquitoes in previous trips where we booked villas with outdoor bathrooms. The private pool is beautiful but the water is extremely cold throughout and pretty deep (1.5m to 1.7m I think) so please make sure that the young ones are accompanied. The location of the villa is excellent on foot but a nightmare for drivers to locate the one & only narrow & confusing entrance to the villa. The exits are easy though. Just a mere 5 mins walk would take you to Seminyak Square & there are plenty of food choices all around. Breakfast by the villa is pretty good for 2 days (as we have used up all the selections) but lots of other options just by walking outside to Seminyak area. Overall, my family enjoyed this experience.
title: Spacious & Comfy Villas tucked away in hard to locate corner in Seminyak

text:
We visited with 2 adults and 2 teen-age boys and had a 2 bdr villa. They arranged 2 single beds in 1 of the rooms (as requested). Only fault is rooms are joining so limited privacy. Main room is awesome with great smart TV, WiFi was also good and surround music via BT was good. We didn't like the electronic curtains or lights as hit and miss but not a big deal. Main room is massive with beautiful big slide doors opening onto the pool (unfortunately cant lock any of the villa). Breakfast was great and huge, plenty if choices.
The staff on the entire property were so great, we were made to feel very welcome.
Spa service in room is great, we all had one. Room service was also very nice. Lounges and bed had some stains but overall clean
I highly recommend the villa for a very relaxing holiday close to all restaurants in Seminyak.

text:
We are 2 couples and spent 5 nights at C151. First night was at c151 Dreamland and the other 4 at C151 Seminyak. Dreamland is an extrordinary on-site experience in location, facilities, and aspect. Our 3 level 4 bedroom  villa was huge (believe the promo material) with large pool overlooking the  ocean. While in room dining was available we took advantage of nearby restaurants. It is to be noted that a vehicle is needed to take advantage of the areas facilities.
Our Club villa in Seminyak was awesome. Location is very central, quiet, very easy walk to eateries, beach, etc. The villa itself is something else ... beautifully presented, very large rooms, private pool, each bedroom with en-suite, enclosed and secure yard. We were lucky to have also experienced the Presidential villa which offers the same as the Club villa plus billiard room, well equipped gym, much larger garden area, which would be an ideal stay for group bookings.
ALL staff are unbelievably accommodating with all requests being acted promptly and efficiently.
It is evident that C151 offers an exceptional experience.

owner_response.title: Tanggapan Pemilik

text:
Lots happening now at C151, repairing / remodelling these luxury villas. Looks like the earlier comments which had made me think twice before booking here are soon gonna be irrelevant.

I had paid for a C151 one bedroom pool villa for the location, privacy and layout which would give me a large enough pool to swim and a place to sunbathe throughout the day. (Many villas in the area seemed to offer only small glimpses of sky. On arrival we were given a special villa: the garden was bigger than I had expected from the description and photos. This upgrade included an outdoor jacuzzi, some pretty flowering trees, a private gym and snooker room.  While we didn't need these, the extra space gave a rather sumptuous feeling to our visit.

The staff were all friendly, helpful and efficient. I asked by email for a blender to make smoothies before we arrived. I was happy to receive a reply saying one would be provided (decent quality too!). The reception staff were warm and friendly, especially Aiyu. They realised quickly how poor my time management is and found ways to offer polite reminders to help us be ready for the occasional tours which they organised for us. Sending a fruit juice over is much nicer than asking "are you gonna be on time for your taxi' - skilfully done guys!

Anyway, on arrival, the butler showed us around the features of the villa and gave us the customary welcome drink. He made sure we knew how to customise the breakfast order to our liking. 

The many remote control handsets (sound, light, curtains, TV, aircon) in each room are kept in a smart velvet folder: great idea I  have never seen before - hid the clutter you find on most coffee tables!
 
While at C151 we connected our phones to the main amp which allowed us to select where we're listened to Spotify and podcasts, we especially loved being secluded enough to play the music pretty loud in the garden while messing about in the pool. ( the staff assured us that nobody could hear it in the vicinity)
My one concern was that the in room safe was too small to store my computer.  I left the computer hooked up to the TV (brought my own hdmi from home) while we were out and was happy to find it was safe and that housekeeping staff had left our valuables and taken away only the mess we leave in our wake each day! 

Wish we could take all this back to Taiwan: the amazing local beach, excellent organic food shop, good restaurants just a gentle stroll away. Thanks to everyone for making our first trip to Bali a most memorable and relaxed one.

text:
This villa used to be good. Used to stay here on 2012ish and it was awesome. 

As of 2016, this place has become a poorly maintained villa with serious repair works needed to be done here and there. Its supposedly a 5 star villa accommodation but really nothing to shown for. Its in a terrible condition.

Here are my complaints:

1. The toilet was broken 4 times on one of the rooms. Complained 4 times and still have the same issue and worst of all the toilet ended up not being able to flush anything. Of the 4 complaints the maintenance guy simply say "oh this is our standard" and call him up again if its not working. Are you kidding me seriously???

2. The water literally smells and taste bad. Complained to the reception and the maintenance department and AGAIN simply told "this is our standard cause we're near the beach". Its a joke really since i've stayed at other hotels/villa near the vicinity and not having this issue. Its embarrassing to see the villa's standard has stoop so low. 

3. Overall maintenance. Simply put some of the rooms especially the bathroom simply needs refurbishment. The state of the materials has clearly been worn. Cigarette marks are on the floor/sink/jacuzzi/table you name it. Seriously you won't get this kind of facility and treatment from a "5 star" villa.

Such a shame. The location is awesome, one of the best but clearly it has been a shadow of its former self...

Regards,
Ardion

text:
C151 Smart Villas has so much potential to be MORE...

I usually would list the pro's before con's but in this case, C151 just did not impress me for how much i paid. Yup its all cool and stuff that its a smart villa, but cool enough to be a smart museum not 2 nights stay..

Cons:
1. When we reached the villa the checkin took too long. 
2. The Villa was not maintained well, it was old furnishing and worn out
3. it was HOT. The living room is a massive area with two AC's out of which only one worked, the other one would never turn on unless we called someone to come help us who went to the back of the villa to play with the wires for it to come on. which still was too hot. 
4. If we thought the living area was hot, out of 3 rooms, only one was cool enough that we did not sweat under the covers. 
5. The water tasted ODD- shower was salty, dispenser dint seem to clean. 
6. They charged us for Mineral water in the fridge
7. We went to the Lobby one night at around 2AM, to find it SHUT. no one to help us locate our driver who was going to drive us up north for sight seeing. 
8. Very unhelpful reception staff
9. They did not clean the rooms and are while we were gone
10. The room service food: 1 out of 3 LOCAL dishes tasted good. and breakfast was not impressive

Pros:
1. Surround sound music system
2. Nice size pool with different coloured lights inside - makes it fun
3. Full kitchen
4. Nice service staff who came to the villa on call
5. great massage but overpriced 
6. Absolutely amazing location, walking distance out to close by shopping, markets and restaurants. Also easy to find and go to places from... 
7. for what it's worth, the toilet's were clean and had a great 'smart system'
8. Buggy service incase you have adults that prefer not to walk too much 
9. Very spacious: Big bathrooms, big living room, big pool, big everything. 
10. We got put into a 3 bedroom even though we booked a 2 bedroom. but have this- they LOCKED the third room. lol, so much for a upgrade? maybe if they opened up the third room we could have tested another AC for them not to get this review..

text:
PLEASE PEOPLE DONT WASTE YOUR MONEY ON THIS PLACE!!!

Bali has much more villa's that are much more worth it.

Usually I don't like to complain about a place I have stayed. But just for this one. I am making an exception in the hope to help people wasting their hard earned money to this place. 

Upon arrival there was no one even trying to help me get suitcases inside the villa. Once I dragged my stuff inside we briefly walked around to find out that is was just disgusting. Foot prints for the previous visitors were all over the place and walls were molded, the rooms smelled like smoke etc. they couldn't give us a new villa because the place was fully booked.

Try to talk to the manager but he was nowhere to be found because he was on holiday and would return the last day of my stay.

Anyway asked them to clean they villa again but took them ages before they started to clean.

Every towel in the Villa smelled like a sweaty sock of all the 4 bathrooms in the house.

All the "smartness" of this villa are not so smart anymore and far outdated!

The showers and bad tubs were badly maintained.

During the BBQ there was noone that assisted at the table.

The last day during check out the manager came to settle the bill where he and his staff listed things on the list which were clearly not been consumed at all and almost got charged 12 million rp for nothing.

It didn't matter what we said but the manager didn't seem to understand that we were beyond disappointed in the place.  

Bottom line is this place has very bad management and I believe with the right management it could live up to its full potential.

However the people do not care about their customers and customers are continually being asked to understand their lack of competence.

But for +900 usd a night customers shouldn't be educating what they pay for.
title: Worst "luxury" villa we have ever stayed

text: I wish I had taken into consideration the bad reviews before booking this villa. Location is amazing but the villa is very poorly maintained and managed. Considering the price they ask this is not acceptable. The whole villa was smelling mold & cigarettes, it was like sleeping in a huge ashtray. The towels were dirty as the floor and everything in the villa. The material they used are not appropriate in front of the ocean and need to be changed. I agree with the review saying they should close and refurbish. They might have security problems one day, specially in the stairs going to the beach.The staff was nice and motivated but I guess they were told to charge everything including water. They only provide us 2 small bottles of water for our whole stay (3 days) making us pay extra water. That reflects the state of mind of the owners. Also we had the same problem with the orange juice. Freshly made for us the first day, it was replaced by a chemical potion the other days. It could be a paradise because of the location and the kind staff but only after they refurbish, replace their electronics which is not smart and learn them to clean like in a 5* hotel or luxury villa.

text: The 3-bedroom villa was absolutely wonderful, totally fell in love with their bathrooms! They delivered fantastic breakfast. text:
We stayed at a 3 bedroom villa at the C151. I read differing reviews prior to our departure which made us nervous that our stay would not be pleasant.
When we arrived, we were greeted by friendly, caring staff who made us feel very welcomed.
We had breakfast delivered promptly to our villa each morning, villa was cleaned every day, and nothing was to much when we needed or requested something. The staff were great! We had an enjoyable stay and we highly recommend C151 Villas in Seminyak, Bali 

Albert
Melbourne, Australia
title: Great place to stay

text:
We stayed at C151 last year and were blown away, the service was beyond fantastic and the villas themselves were wonderful. Unfortuantely we rebooked this year before looking at TripAdvisor again and seeing all of the recent reviews. 
The moment we got to the Villas we felt something wasnt right - our greeting was cold and nothing special. The staff that took us to our villa were nice and trying their best, but you could tell they had lost a lot of enthusiasm. We then asked the staff and they said only 7 of the villas were still open due to the legal battle going on - which we later read about on trip adivisor. There were only a few staff manning the villas hence the lack of service.

The list of issues began to pile from day one:

When we got to our villa, our fridge had not been stocked up, there were bugs inside, the air conditioning would cool down the main lounge and kitchen room. The pool and furniture seemed under maintained since last visit, we had burn holes in the couches and rust on the seats.

One morning when I was sleeping in, Reception rang through to the bedroom at 8am and woke me up, when I answered they said 'one moment please' and then transferred me a cold caller marketing call trying to sell me something. I rang back reception to complain and to ask why the call was sent through and where it came from, I was told I would be called back - never heard anything.

When we went to check out, we were given a ridiculous bill which we hadn't even made! They were trying to charge us for the items that were missing from the mini bar when we checked in plus other items we had no idea about. The check out took a long time as he had to call his managers etc to get the bill sorted.

We were then told that the 'holding fee' that is placed at the beginning of your stay would take 2 weeks to go back onto our credit card - which is ridiculous as all other hotels released the remaining costs immediately, plus we were not told this when putting the costs down.

The staff member who we checked out with couldn't care less about our complaints and did nothing in the way of apologizing or trying to make up for the fact that we payed $500 per night for a 2 star stay and service, let alone all of the hassle and issues we incurred!

Absolutely horrendous. Do not stay here. It is not worth it. A year ago I would have recommended this place to anyone, now I wouldn't suggest it at all.
title: Horrible! Nothing like it used to be.

text:
It's not to expectations. When you build a villa's strength based on technology, it gets outdated quickly. CD and DVD players but yet no universal plug points or USB outlets. No iPhone (iDevice) players. I would have expected AppleTV.  There's an oven but no microwave oven. 

Worse, the smart toilet smells of year-old urine. I called housekeeping to clean but the stench remains.

I do not recommend this place.
title: Almost...

text:
We booked four nights at the C151 Smart Villas in July 2014, we stayed for 2 nights and on the morning of the third day as we were leaving to sightsee, we noticed an order attached to our door saying that by court order we could no longer re-enter the villa.  We left for lunch and when we returned found all the owners of about 8 villas with police and solicitors approaching guests and asking them to leave.  Apparently the C151 had rented the rooms and had not reimbursed the owners of the villas!  We wasted a whole day whilst waiting in the lobby with our luggage, waiting for staff to book another room elsewhere!  They wanted to put us in a villa in the middle of nowhere and we had to insist on something closer as this is why we had stayed there to begin with.
The Staff at C151 who had to deal with the drama were not aware of what was happening and I truly felt for them.  Not the best way to end your holiday!  Every other villa that we stayed at was fabulous and a wonderful experience.
title: Beware! Total Nightmare!!!!!  Avoid if you want to enjoy your holiday!

text:
We were unfortunate enough to be staying with our family at C151 during the month of July. On the second day of our four day stay, as we left the villas, we noticed that a notice (attached in photos) warned us that despite having paid, by court order we were unable to re-enter the villa.
We went for lunch not really understanding what was happening and on return found the complex swarming with police and some of the owners of the villas.  The owners were polite and courteous and expressed regret that we had been caught up in a dispute between them and the management company.  There were however other heavies around who I personally found extremely intimidating.  
As can be imagined the whole situation was somewhat chaotic and quite frightening.  Staff did the best they could.  We were unable to talk to anyone in management.  We asked if we could stay on for the days we had paid for but were left in no doubt that we needed to pack up and get out. The heavies wedged open the doors of one of the villas and appeared to be partying.

Frankly if I had been told that in Bali, it was possible to evict guests who had paid for accommodation I would not have believed it.
title: Nightmare at C151

text: Back in 2012 we visited these villas to check them out for our next visit at the time they were new and the staff were fantastic. We just went back last week to re look at them as we couldn't get in this trip due to them being booked out and the staff were appalling-we did email them first to make a booking to view a Vila and they never responded so we went there and they ignored us for 30 mins then told us to come back the next day. The following day we returned to be ignored for 15 mins and then taken through. Needless to say the villas are now run down and not looked after. The grounds used to be immaculate which you would expect at 1500 per night but they have been badly neglected and are looking very tired and need a paint badly. Glad we made the effort or we would be very disappointed if we committed to that price and got that in return.
title: C151 not what it used to be

text: I have spent one of the best times in this Villa. Very relaxing and luxurious. There are many rooms. It is very spacious. The view is amazing and relaxing. The pool is big and nice. Thanks. I hope to visit again.
title: Best Villa

text: Visited this villa after online booking.  Three bedroom villa was great.  No smell, recently painted and overhauled. Excellent staff and service.  We were vegetarian and they daily served excellent breakfast hot and delicious of our choice. They went extra mile to make our stay memorable. All smart devices in villa worked.  Pool was really really good and was well kept.  Only problem was little ants that were in Kitchen.  They tried everything to get rid of them and they did not bother us most of the time.  The location is excellent and best thing is it is adjoining KUDETA the best restaurant in Bali.  Highly appreciated.
title: Excellent Villa

text: We stayed as a family in the C151 villas Seminyak for 10 days and absolutely loved it. Heaps of space to accommodate 5 adults, the private pool was beautiful and well maintained and the staff were lovely and very accommodating. The villa was in a great location, just off the main road and in easy walking distance to a lot of shops and restaurants (including Ku De Ta). Would happily recommend and go back, we loved it!
title: Amazing place to stay!

text:
We were looking for a spot for a romantic vacation and tired from work we also needed a space to relax. So a pool villa sounded like the perfect choice.
This place did not disappoint us! Spectacular living room facing the pool, hug pool for two persons and the music sound all around the house and under the water was a plus!
Staff is very kind but a little too pushy; if there is a do not disturb sign outside they still ring the bell.... and if you do not answer they call you on the phone... 
Not so intelligent villa, to many remotes. And too many gadgets need a lot of maintenance so a few of them were not working.
title: Perfect spot for romantic and/or relaxing vacations

text: We stayed here for 5 nights in March , We booked a 1 bedroom villa,but we were allocated a 2 bedroom villa.   Loved it ! The pool was warm,loved all the smart features, TVs everywhere , ice machine in the huge fridge,spa baths, theatre room, the list goes on .The staff were great breakfast in the villa was good. The location was perfect ,next to Ku De Ta & very close to the beach. The only negative thing is the villa needs a lick of paint ..   I will be going again next year! We stayed in villa 5. Near reception..
title: Loverly villa close to all the in places.

owner_response.text:
Dear Clare K

Greetings from Bali and C151!

Thank you for your positive comments and I am glad to hear that you enjoyed your stay with us including our luxury SMART concept facilities, to our friendly attentive staff and the in villa breakfast. 

I will be sure to pass on your comments to all of our team here and when you are ready to return to stay with us again, please contact myself personally at mark@c151.net to arrange. 

Thank you once again and I will see you soon to experience smart luxury at its finest next year!

Regards

Mark Stanford
GENERAL MANAGER

PS: I have noted your comment in regards to the painting and have scheduled with my Chief Engineer to check. All of our villas partake in a continuous maintenance programme to ensure we remain as the leader in luxury villa accommodations within Bali.
owner_response.title: Tanggapan Pemilik

text:
At first look these villas are fantastic but beneath the surface there are lots of small niggles.  I don't believe I ever thought that you could have too much technology but these villas have too many things to go wrong and obviously nobody able to fix them.  Jacuzzi bath didn't work.  Kept getting electrocuted by the massage bed !!! And we were bitten to death by Bali creepy crawlies.  The electrics would give any British building inspector a heart attack !!
We paid full price and so expected a lot for the money we were paying but were disappointed. We ended up leaving early and going back to Singapore and management refused any sort of refund on the 7 remaining nights we had already paid.
On the plus side the service was excellent and staff very helpful.
title: Looks can be deceiving

text:
Definitely one of our best stays ever! 
We have been the first guest at the new villas, so we got a special welcome ceremony which was really great! 
The location is amazing as well as the service. The staff was very attentive, friendly and obliging. They took care of us and fulfilled every wish we had. 
The villa is very modern and nice. There is enough space for 6-8 guests. 
Unfortunately the villa had a few little problems cause as mentioned no one stayed there before . Im sure these little problems will be fixed very quick also because the general manager was very interested to our feedback and already assigned the staff to solve these things. By the way, the GM was very open to our critics and was very cooperative.
Finally we definitely recommend this place to spend unforgettable holidays.
title: A Dream!

text: A very different place to stay - certainly luxurious looking.  We booked this last minute as it was impromptu and consequently got a great deal as we needed the three bed villa.  We were travelling with my partners mother and his two children.  Breakfast was good (not great) and the rooms were spacious and each had its own bathroom ensuite which was good.  There was a good living area that could be closed off and kept cool, and the pool was a great size.  However, I would point out that the 'Smart' bit of the villa is a bit too smart!  You needed a 'How To' guide to work the spa bath and the toilets were a scream!  There were no notes on the light switches (all together in the lounge room) so you frequently turned off someone elses lights or turned ON their sound system.  Also, the pool area was extremely slippery when wet (we kept putting towels down) and the doors to the rooms were very heavy to handle. If you had the lounge area open then the pool water would splash in as it was very close. Look, it was a great location - next to Seminyak Square and close to all the action, but it is an expensive option for gadgets that you probably won't appreciate! Probably wouldn't stay again.
title: Good Location...but...

text:
I booked this last minute through a last minute website as a cheap option. I was totally blown away by the place! It's was simply amazing and for the price, much better than the Oberoi next door where a friend of mine was staying. 
The room service was good, the lobby staff a bit on the slow side, but they did drive me in a golf cart to meet friends at Oberoi next door.
title: Amazing

text:
The location is cool but the concept is a bit pretentious : too much electronics is spoiling the recipe. It's a fantastic location at one step from Oberoi, Kudeta and walking distance to the beach (even with young children). However the lobby's communal swimming pool is a no man's land giving an awkward first impression of the resort. (Dismantled daybeds laying all around the pool during our stay.)

The service leaves mixed feelings. On our check-in even though we have already payed half of our stay, the receptionist focussed on cashing-in the second half of our rental and did not show much consideration for any other matters. Generally speaking the staff members are trying to be helpful but lack training.
+
Location, location, location
The room service (plus the daily breakfast delivered to the villa) were very good. 
The compound is quiet even though the are in a busy area.
Overall, I would  recommend them first   to give to the communal pool   a major cleaning in order to reflect the villas'quality.
I would probably come back.
title: Mixed feelings

text: Stayed in one of the bigger villas (#21) as C151 and it was excellent.  We travelled with two children, five and nine, who were thrilled with the automatic toilets, plasma TV's in 'every' room, large clean pool and outdoor speakers.  Staff were very friendly and helpful, and our only complaint was we had to come home.  There is a small market out the front, and it's next to the Oberoi and KuDeTah with a small walk to some of the great restaurants.
title: Loved it, we'll be back

text:
C151 villas are fantastic - very private and well designed. The private swimming pool was great and music played in the living room was also playing through speakers in the pool, the terrace, the bedroom and the bathroom.  We stayed there for 5 days and definitely would consider going there next time we go to Bali. 

The location is handy to the shops and restraurants in Seminyak too. 

The staff were friendly but sometimes the service was variable. On two of the three mornings that we asked for a wake up call we didn't get it and the front desk was not very useful in identifying restaurants or local services - they tried hard but did not seem very knowledgeable. 

The room was very high tech with all lighting, air con and curtains handled through remote control but some of the basics were less well done. The bath was supposed to be like an infinity pool where the water drained away but you had to get in slowly or the drains were overwhelmed and the bathroom flooded. We gave up trying to get the plug to pop back up so we could not get water back out afterwards.
title: Great villa, but service variable

text:
Everything about C151 was amazing.  The villa, the staff, the location - it was all perfect.  Without a doubt the most gorgeous place I've ever stayed, there was even a plasma screen tv in the toilet!

Worth every cent.  Will never stay anywhere else in Bali ever again!!
title: Amazing

text: I loved this hotel and the service. They picked us up from the airport in air condintioned MB van. So nice to have a ride waiting after a 20+ hr fllight. The ride to the hotel was about 25 min. I was not expecting to find such a luxurious villa in Bali. I did some research on-line b4 making a booking and the pix did not disappoint. The villa was stunning and huge. My kids (2) each had a room and so did my husband and I. Plus a full kitchen, not that we did any cooking. And we had our own private pool. The villa was immaculate, the beds were comfy, and all the electronic ammenities (my kids loved playing with the toilet, you have to go to know what I'm talking about). And again more air conditioning. Bali is HOT - so it was nice to go out for a day and come back to an air conditioned room. The staff was so kind and attentive. They helped with making a booking for my daughter and me to go horse back riding at Umalas stables (also highly recommend this). Room service was great, fresh juice and fruit in the mornings, what a treat. Dinner service was a bit slow, but we usually went out for dinner. There are so many restaurants within walking distance and a great spot for sunset drinks right next door, KuDeTa. Also within walking distance is Seminyak beach and a new shopping center, Seminyak Square, but some of the shops were still vacant. But a short taxi ride along Jalan Oberoi and you'll find plenty of shops. I'm sure I'm leaving out tons of other things I loved about this hotel, but just go and you'll love it too.
title: High tech oasis in the midst of beautiful Bali

text:
We have been on many trips to Bali and have stayed in various Hotels and this trip we decided to stay in the Beautiful C151 Villas. Well where can I start !!! Magnificent. Upon arriving very late in the early hours of the morning the staff were Brilliant. The service was impeccable, The Villas were impeccable and we all felt like we were totally spoilt. Nothing is ever to much trouble at C151 Villas. We traveled with a group of 6 including 4 (20 year) girls. They all had a great time. I would highly recommend these Villas to everyone. We felt very safe and secure. The pool is awesome and the Day Beds ......... well lets say that once your on them you just don't ever want to leave. We had in Villa massages and a BBQ night, again all exceptional. We stayed in a 3 bedroom Villa, awesome, and if you love gadgets, you will love these villas, its have everything from TVs in the bathrooms to electric self flushing toilets hahaha. What more could you ask for !!!!!!
We highly recommend the Villas and will definitely being staying at the Villas again.

Family From Western Australia
title: ABSOLUTLEY FANTASTIC

text:
Head to C151 soon, the villas are luxurious and the staff welcoming

We wanted a relaxing week for our first trip to Bali, and were not disappointed. The location is excellent, two minutes from Ku De Ta bar one way, and the shops and restaurants of Siminyak the other.

The Villas themselves are very private (entry is through a sliding door, controlled by the credit card style key) and stylishly (and Western) design. Nothing seems to have been spared, apart maybe from longevity. I agree with the last poster that the villa seem a bit badly built at times, but if you report a problem to housekeeping we found them round like a shot to sort out all problems.

Tried the room service (plus the daily breakfast delivered to the villa) and in room massage and both were very good.
Overall, I would thoroughly recomment this place, and am surprised it is not higher up the list
title: So relaxing

text:
Brand new villas, with a great location. 
Pros:
- Beautiful pool with spacious bedrooms & bathrooms (the first impression is awesome)
- Very good amenities & fittings (7 flat screen tv, jacuzzies in every bathroom, etc)
-  great location (next to Oberois)

Cons:
- Basic maintenance issues (aircon not working properly, tv not tuned, mosquito repellant mats not installed, etc)
- staff was not adequately trained (asked to speak to the manager when we checked in..and finally managed to speak to him when we checked out, to give him our feedback), butler service available but hardly much help, language a big issue as well.
- the beach is a 5 mins buggy ride, but the beach is very dirty
- overall not worth USD800++ we paid for a 3 bedroon villa. (they charge everything @10500 rupiah/USD which inflates the bill by another 8-10%)
title: well designed villas - but poor maintenance

text: Between the impeccable design and the large, private space, this place is the best. I truly enjoyed taking multiple swims in the pool daily - big enough to swim in properly - as well as the excellent massages. Walking to the Ku de Ta restaurant/club - essentially you need not ever leave this bubble.. A stressed out business traveler on a 3 day sojourn I returned relaxed and refreshed.
title: I was relaxed after 24 hours

text:
We stayed at these villas by default as we were upgraded from a resort in Kuta due to lack of rooms.  I found the staff at C151 to be friendly and helpful and their presentation was always of a high standard. The rooms are very well equiped with up-to-date technology. (There are enough remotes to satisfy anyone.) You can utilise fingerprint activated safes in the bedrooms, the flat screen TVs, 9 throughout, and the 3 spas and 1 sauna. The Pool was kept in immaculate condition and there was plenty of seating. We had a 2 room villa and there were 4 single lounges with seating to accommodate a further 4-6. Housekeeping staff were efficiency personified.Breakfast was wonderful, although I've yet to taste great bacon in Bali.
Overall, C151 was a resort that I will try to experience again.
The only real downside was that due to the opaque glass walls surrounding our villa, we found that we became isolated. The only contact we had with other people was when we ventured out into Seminyak or Kuta. For me this was a bit of a problem, but, for a lot of others, this would be a huge bonus.
title: Brilliant

text:
We have been to Bali about 14 times and stayed everywhere from The Legian to rustic cottages.  Overall we really liked C151 - but only at the discounted price (unless there are 6 of you where it would be worthwhile - except there are only 2 pool loungers per vills).

Very friendly staff and proactive service,  The technology is in fact a bit overhyped - and does not always function how it should.  Also very slow wifi compared with most other places.

Very convenient and close to the best of everything.

What we liked most:
- very clean
- good bed
- great stereo and pool
- location.

Areas for improvement:
- staff calling after 9pm about an admin issue
- the pool self-drained 1/3 of its contents day 1
- the touch open safes take like 30 goes to open
- could do with a Buddha's head or two in the garden.

Not The Legian or Como - but close.
title: Very convenient and mostly 'there'

text: Located in Seminyak, where all the new cafes and clubs are sprouting, but the villas' conditions and its furnitures are getting a bit old and unkempt. The smart toilet that I stayed wasn't that smart already, the AC in the gym blows nothing but air, and the breakfast menu was so limited.
title: Nice villa with swimming pool

text: Very friendly staff that helped in anyway they could and good location close to shops and not to far from the beach, just a few small problems with things not working properly like the bathtub jets and the toilet controls in some of the rooms and the front door entrance and noisy aircon we kind of fixed ourself, the pool was great and and the breakfast was really good, I would definitely stay there again
title: Definitely enjoyed

text:
Let me start off by saying that I am a pretty particular individual when it comes to my travel accommodations and I like things to be nice, clean, and well maintained.  I expect things to be as advertised .  I am quite happy to pay for what I want but then do expect things to be as they say they are.  

We arrived at the resort really late so there was just security staff available when we checked in but despite a bit of a language barrier, everything went well and they got us into our villa quickly so we could go to bed.  They took us to our villa with our luggage on a golf cart which was nice as it was a bit of a distance from the lobby.  Unfortunately the route to the villa is quite dark and on evenings out for dinner, I would have definitely felt more comfortable with a more well lit walkway.  

We had received notice that a driver would meet us at the airport and take us back to the hotel but we never found him and had to rent a cab which was about 200,000 (approx 20.00 CAD).   I won't lie, this frustrated me because, we thought we had our transportation lined up and at midnight, I didn't want to be hanging around the airport looking for our driver and being repeatedly approached by taxi drivers looking to take us to where we wanted to go.   Due to the language barrier, we never really did find out what happened to our driver or why he wasn't at the airport when we landed.  

The villa we stayed in was beautiful and in its day, was probably fabulous but you could definitely see some of the wear and tear from years of use.  The drapes in both the bedroom and living rooms open and close by remote and the glass doors open so that the whole room becomes an extension of the pool area.  It was so hot that we kept the doors closed to keep in cool in the the living area.  The blinds in the living room didn't work but that may have just been a dead battery in the remote.  Honestly, we didn't even mention it to the staff, as the drapes were opened enough for our liking.  It has a beautiful stereo system that goes throughout the villa and pool.  It was really nice having the music going while sitting out at the pool.   The rain shower was the best I'd ever used.   The pool was amazing and huge.    It was well used as the weather was so hot and humid. The villa is well lit and lots of lights around the pool which is nice when coming back from a late dinner.  We were able to lock the gate coming into the villa and it was completely private once inside the compound area.  

 The staff came early the next morning with breakfast which was so nice as we hadn't had a chance to order due to coming in so late the night before.  They set it up at our table for us and make us fresh Bali coffee.  It was delicious and so nice to have breakfast in our own space in your pyjamas as opposed to having to get up and go somewhere during a scheduled timeframe.    We were able to assign a time for it to be delivered (if we wanted to sleep late or get and early start) and it was right on time every time, piping hot and fresh.  There was a large water cooler in our kitchen which has hot and cold setting for drinking and coffee.  There is bottled water as well in the bathrooms for drinking and brushing teeth. 

The staff at this resort is absolutely incredible.  So hard working and gracious and so willing to help with any request.   Quick, efficient and so willing to please.  They came quickly when we asked for something, kept everything clean and tidy and kept us well stocked with clean dry towels.  They came everyday to clean our villa and the pool and otherwise left us to ourselves unless we needed them.  Breakfast was brought to our villa every morning and each day we filled out a order form for the next morning.  They had a large room service menu as well.

Restaurants and shops were literally right around the corner from our villa and we never had to walk very far to find amazing food for supper.  

Our checkout was smooth and easy and they called us a taxi to take us to Obud.  

Overall Impression: My  first impression was that I was a little underwhelmed.  It is not the grand resort entrance that I have come to expect in places like Mexico or the Dominican Republic.   The villa is clean but is dated and could use some minor upgrades and  maintenance.  Generally just basic minor stuff which really didn't affect our stay in any way.  The pathway to our villa was dark and really could use more lighting.  

The staff are truly one of the best parts of this place.  Warm, friendly and so attentive despite some minor issues with the different languages.  

I would have liked to have some sort of a resort guide to refer to as far as how to get ahold of the desk, breakfast routines, spa services etc as well as a listing of some of the villa features.  I think it would have been helpful.  

 I would stay here again and hopefully one day can return.  Being from Canada, I found the incredibly high humidity a bit of a challenge and would maybe want to revisit Bali again in the dry season.  The accommodations though were amazing and we were very happy with our stay.  We were able to rest and relax by the pool and go out for nice dinners in the evenings which is what we wanted.
title: The pool and the staff were definitely the best part...

text: 4 people stayed here for 4 nights.  The room was changed due to construction work, but the other services were excellent and I am very satisfied.  In particular, Mr. dewi, who took care of me the most during these 4 days, had a wonderful smile and gave me happiness every time I met him.  I would like to use it again when I go to Bali.  thank you very much.
title: Our wonderful stay‪‪❤︎‬

text:
Pros :
- The pool is big and clean
- The rooms are clean
- Shower is superb

Cons : 
- Only few variant for breakfast
- Must renovate like sliding door but didn’t bother me at all

But My Family and I really love the Villa..Thanks for the experience C151 Smart Villa..
title: I love the villa

text:
the overall stay was great, the service is excellent ... huge living space for my kids to run around with ... just need bit upgrade with the bathroom .. the light is a bit dark and the smart toilet not always work...

maybe need a bit a uv vaccum clean i think with the sofa in the living room since my baby develop a bit redness on his skin ... but overall everything was excellent ..

the location was perfect within walking distance to foods and convenience store. the pool was great and my kids love every bit of it and demand to swim everyday when we stay there.

the breakfast are many .. the cereal, the eggs and the pancakes are perfect but maybe need more improvement with the nasi goreng (its very plain).
title: spacious space for family to spend time with .... need a bit upgrade with the bathroom

text: A number of reviewers have pointed out that the gates to the villas don't always work. Today while inside our villa during heavy rain we saw the gates open and shut on their own and anyone could have walked in if we hadn't been home. In the evening we tried to get in and the gates wouldn't accept the code. It was pouring with rain and so one person had to scale the fence to get in. With no-one in the office to let us in, there was no alternative. This is something they need to sort out because it is not great to be locked out in the rain.
title: Beware of the front gates to the villas

text: Overall stay was fantastic, service is superb, location and wide spread of breakfast made our stay even more rewarding. Only setback is the facilities in the villa needs furnishing especially all the sliding doors.
title: Memorable and rewarding staycay

text:
It's sad to see how COVID damaged this pretty property. Only a few of their villas are operational. Most are deserted like jungle. It is a bit run down with visible wears and tears everywhere and needs some serious upgrades. 2 toilets are usable (howere they used to be electronic and fansy).
The villa is huge, well equipped, only steps away from reasonably priced eateries and beach. Staffs are nice and polite. They respond to request quickly. Breakfast is nicely served in villa but lacks of variety. Beds are huge and comfortable. Pool is nice especially for kids. Suggest to include manual lock function at the front gate as I don't feel secured knowing that the gate can be opened by staffs (although I know they are professional). I will still it consider value for money and recommend it. I hope to return in future seeing it in better shape.
title: Good villa but needs some serious upgrade

text: Everything was great, however sadly the villas maintenance very poorly 😢  the main gate unable to open with the code on the 2nd day. Some of the glasses gate are broken. I think if the villa still maintaine the cleanliness and the facilities it'll be perfect!
title: C151 review

text: We are a family of 5 and wanted enough space for everyone. The villa completely met our needs. The location is excellent. Walking distance to the main strip in Seminyak. The property itself is definitely needing some maintenance, but that didn't bother us. The location and space more than made up for it. COVID has meant that not all villas are open. Staff were super friendly and helpful, we would definitely stay again.
title: Superb location and villa completely met our needs

text: We had 2 villas at c151.  After 5 years it was my 2nd stay.  The pandemic has leave a trap.  From 20 villas only 7 are open for tourists.  The Villa are not the newest. Some facilities are not working anymore. The service was very nice. The breakfast was very good. The location is perfect.  Just 5 min walk from Seminyak Square.  We can recommend the villas.
title: Nice stay at c151

text: We studied a number of reviews before planning the holidays, so we thought that the website pictures were not up to date for sure; but we decided to book early because of the big pool and the position near the center of Seminyak and the beach clubs, and finally the big discount for the advanced booking. In fact, the villa needs some refit, as pointed out by many reviews, but it is just in terms of finishing because everything goes well in every furniture and installation. Despite this, the villa is large and well-furnished as described in the plans. But we said “wonderful august” because the workers and the employer made the difference. A lot of difference! They are so kind and effective 24/24, so they turned our good stay in an excellent way. Starting from the breakfast, absolutely plenty of food and delicious, all the people are ready to comply any needs of the customers. Everything you need, you have just to ask. The regular services are excellent and also the extra-charge ones. What a team! Congratulations!!!
title: Wonderful august

text: The staff were very hospitable, helpful and friendly. Villa was very clean and conveniently located in Seminyak. Bedrooms and living room was huge. Pool is located right outside the bedrooms and living room and was very clean and well-maintained. Very good experience.
title: Great villa in Seminyak

text: The villa was huge, well maintained and absolutely beautiful. The service staff were very helpful and sweet. The breakfast was delicious and served in the villa. Loved the stay and will definitely visit again ❤️
title: Beautiful villas, great service

owner_response.text: Glad to know that you had great experience during your stay with us, your comment is much appreciated and we are hoping to welcoming you back in near future
owner_response.title: Tanggapan Pemilik

text:
Perfect location, 5 minutes to beach and even less to shopping centres and Seminyak Square and villas are huge and very quiet. Staff are all lovely and very helpful. We were on half board so mostly had breakfast and dinner at the villa, food could be a bit hit and miss and not very hot although most meals were substantial. 
As many others have said, there has been very little maintenance carried out for some time. Doors are warped and either very difficult or impossible to lock, dining chairs are worn or split and lounges are worn and stained.
Our bath towels were good quality and fairly new, pool towels had to be requested but were also good quality, bath robes were not provided as advertised, although we did not specifically request them so they may have been available.
Oddly, there were no bedside lights in either bedroom.
Microwaves would be very helpful, particularly if you are staying with children.
Pool is huge, again much maintenance is needed but the water was very clean and it's great to have a private pool.
As long as you don't expect perfection, C151 is a convenient and comfortable place to stay.
title: Excellent location but poorly maintained

owner_response.text: Thank you for your constructive review, your reviews related to towels and doors would be our main concern to be fixed and we had working on those concerns and hopefully we could welcoming you back in near future
owner_response.title: Tanggapan Pemilik

text: We stayed for 2 nights in a 2 bedroom villa. Let me start by saying the staff did what they could to rectify issues, there was no manager on site, however I feel its important for travellers to have their expectations clear, hence my review is detailed as they could be suitable for some. These villas are very old and not maintained. The communal pool is derelict and mouldy (they were trying to scrub it with bleach) and the communal bar area is not usable and held up with acro props.Breakfast was poor, edible but we chose to eat out after one morning of it. Dining chairs were gross.Our pool filter was so loud it was removed completely after the first day as we couldn't sleep and it was going all night.Apparantly broken. The pool light was hanging off but was fixed after the first day.None of the doors to the villas locked, including the living room and all bedrooms that opened up to the pool. Was fixed the first day but the same problem occurred again that night. The couches were stained,covered in cigarette burns , other furniture stained, scratched and in desperate need of an update. Safe in our room didn't work so we given a master key to utilise. Literally No shower pressure(it was a trickle) Towels and sheets need replacing.In the end we gave up asking for things to be fixed, cut our losses and moved to another property after day 2 (we still had 6 nights left in Bali).Pros:location and size.Cons:dirty/dusty/old/unsafe/Technology that doest work and is no longer relevant.
title: Terrible-needs overhaul

text:
Whilst the Villas need some maintenance and there is wear on the furniture and towels need updating desperately, the staff and security were excellent. They went out of their way to assist and respond to every request. The Villas are huge with ample space and privacy right in the heart of Seminyak. Once you are here you can walk to everything, beaches, shopping, restaurants and markets are all just outside your private Villa. We had a family of five and the kids absolutely loved the pool and the spa baths as well as the sound system where they could dance or swim with their own music and plenty of space. 

Pros- Location-Privacy-Space-Staff-Spa-Kitchen-Daily clean

Cons-Weathered-Towels-Maintenance

Suggestions: Please get a microwave for the kitchens and replace ALL towels.

text: The photos on their website are deceiving - on first impressions you are wowed by the size of the villas but then you get a closer look and realise that this facility does not care about its guests or the environment they are staying in. The pool if full of mould, sinks not cleaned properly and the build up of grime around the taps is disgusting, dont put a towel on the floor as the floors are so dirty they will come up grey. Benches are not wiped down properly and there are stains on all the furniture. Be careful of the mini bar as they do not provide you with a list and when you ask for one half of what is listed in not actually in the villa. You will receive phone calls every morning from the front reception telling you there is someone on the phone for you about a booking you have made, when you tell them you dont have a booking anywhere they put the call through anyway and you get a delighted person on the other end of the phone telling you that they have exciting news for you (I wonder if the villa gets some sort of kick back for these calls), needless to say they are extremely annoying and the reception staff should know better. Automatic door opens by itself when you are not near it which limits privacy. Front reception area is a mess and in desperate need of renovation. 7 days in a row our place mats for breakfast were just put back in the draw and never cleaned, we eventually cleaned them ourselves as they were so dirty and sticky. Pool never cleaned and the filth and mould just increased in it daily. I read about there being a room service menu but there is not one available. Technology such as lights, surround sound and curtains is very hit and miss and frequently doesnt work.Things like coffee are not refilled and neither is cutlery and cups, they are just taken away and you have to ring to get a teaspoon sent back up. These Villas were probably once 5 star but are now maybe 3. The location is good - one of the few positives I have found. At the price we have paid there are much better value for money places out there so dont waste your money.
title: Disapointing

text:
We first stayed here a few years ago when the land next door was still a rice field, so this  is our second stay. Booked last minute through Agoda and got a great price for a 3br villa. Checked in late at 10pm and was soon ushered by buggy to the 3br villa not far from the lobby.

Nice surprise that we got a newly renovated villa No.9 as apparently they’re undergoing renovations for all the villas. Everything in the villa was in good working condition, clean and well maintained. 

Plus: 
- Good prices for private villa
- Excellent location: between Seminyak Square and Ku De Ta.
- Large villa,large pool (1.6m)
- Attentive staff: receptive to guests requests
- Full kitchen: new refrigerators
- Newly renovated villas: new paint, new wood floor coating
- Good breakfast
- Hardly any mosquitoes or flies
- Good soundsystem (Bose speakers)

Minus: 
- Too much chlorine in the pool
- Strong urine odor in toilet
- Toilet bowl needs water spray to help with cleaning
- Old towels
- No parking
- Low security presence
- Dark alleyways

Having said all of the above, the area is safe to walk around by yourself as there’s lots of tourists out and about and we felt very comfortable in the villa itself... we’d love to come back again... :)
title: Good villas , great location

text:
Our trip to C151 Smart villas was so disappointing. After booking our holiday, we decided to upgrade to the 'so called' presidential suite as a special treat for our friends. 

The villas were dirty, the butler service was less than average and many of the items listed as part of the villa were not included. The water in one apartment was cold, there were spiders and spider webs in the shower, the cleanliness of the kitchen was disgusting. The whole place is aged and run down. 

When asking for an iron and ironing board, we were advised there were none available in the complex. When an iron finally arrived, the cord was frayed and too dangerous to use. There were no robes in the bathrooms, there were no coat hangers, the bedheads in the rooms were grubby. We attempted room service and the staff did not understand our request. 

When we went to get into bed in one of the apartments, there were bugs in the bed. The one and only meal we had delivered was breakfast, which was simply inedible. 

We were so disgusted with the cleanliness of the villas and the service provided that we left after one night.

We did raise our concerns on the evening we arrived and we were advised that these issues were all rectified. This was not the case.

back to villa later that day, I requested a meeting from the manager and I was advised that no one was available on that day. I left my phone number and advised I would return again. Between then and the next day I had no call, email or any contact from villa. Again, if I was paying $100 per night for a room then, I would expect this level of service but I wasn't I had paid in advance approx $1200 per night. 

When I returned again, I met the eCommerce manager and I have never been more disgusted in the level of client service in my life.

During this meeting, the general/eCommerce manager was completely unprofessional and would not even acknowledge our concerns. He was outright rude, continually smirked at my comments and would not even look at me. He was not interested in anything, other than informing me that I was lying about the cleanliness of the villas. When I showed a photo of bugs in the bed., I was told I could have taken the photo anywhere. I was informed  that items such as robes, an iron, turndown services was available only on request. These were not standard - again I remind you, I am supposedly staying in a luxury villa.

When I asked to go back through the villa and show him the issues we had with cleanliness, he advised that the villa had been rebooked for the nights we had already booked so we couldn't. 

He also advised that even if we could,  he still wouldn't believe me that there was an issue. His villas had never had a complaint about cleanliness. short, he took no responsibility for his establishment or staff.

I requested 2 of the 4 nights accomodation refunded (we only stayed one night) however we were flatly refused. 

We were offered - 2 nights accomodation to be used at ANY TIME at EITHER of the C151 villas in Bali.  I was informed I would have this emailed to me however insisted on not leaving until I received a signed voucher. 

The voucher arrived, which the terms of the voucher to be used 'before December 2017' and only for the C151 villas in Seminyak. This I disputed and finally one of his staff arrived with a non transferable voucher for valid 12 months. And I was accused of lying!!

These villas are NOT luxury.
title: Not luxury villas

text:
Shocking stay more than disappointing. We stayed in Bali for several weeks and intended to stay at a number of resorts including c151. This hotel is certainly not as advertised, starting with an underwhelming check in, being double billed on two separate credit cards after being told one didn't work, not only this but they collect full payment at check in something I am not accustomed to. I only realised when checking banking, when querying this the staff were not obliging in fixing the concern & I was short paid back a week later taking into account the charged exchange rate. This alone I could live with however this was the beginning.

We were booked for four nights at $600 odd per night, most technology features were problematic, a issue with the fridge not being connected for ice and then leaking, an air con unit failing to keep the media room under 27 degrees, sound system broken, cold water in the shower, problems with television reception plus several others. We endeavoured to be reasonable but at 600 usd per night this is a shocking experience needing technicians in your room constantly. This would not constitute 3 star in my opinion!

After 24 hours and no improvement I contacted management given our issues and being on our honeymoon to suggest we wanted to check out and receive a refund for the un used portion of our stay, to my surprise they suggested they would not refund. After much stress and argument and hours later they agreed to refund and that it would be done within 24 hours.

Weeks later and after discussions with my bank and the hotel eventually I received a refund in the meantime they had charged my card again, absolute disgrace and completely unscrupulous behaviour, to need to suggest legal action to receive a refund after having a signed document claiming the refund would be done is a joke. Stay clear folks!
title: Not as expected

text:
I arrived 6th July for three-day stay. On the morning of 7th, notices from the courts appeared on the doors of many of the villas saying that they were not to be used, whether already paid for or not. Initially we ignored them, believing it was part of a long term legal process that would continue until after we had left. When we returned from lunch, the reception area was full of owners, police and some dubious-looking characters. 
One of the owners, accompanied by his solicitor, explained that many of the owners had not been paid by for four years by the Canadian company managing the villas and that they had no alternative than to evict guests of the affected villas. We were obliged to pack immediately and vacate, despite having paid for two more nights.
No-one was on hand from the management company. Some guests, particularly those with children, were distressed at having to find alternative accommodation. To be fair, the hotel staff in reception despite, whilst no doubt fearing whether they would have jobs at the end of the day, did their best to find alternative accommodation. We quickly relocated to the Nyaman Villas, a short walk away, after checking that C151 would pay the bill in advance. This proved to be a blessing, as Nyaman was far superior in every way.
title: Avoid while dispute between villa owners and managers unresolved

text:
What were Smart suites aren’t so smart in this day and age. Old amplifiers with processors which peak-out & shut-out easily when iPhones are plugged in. Poorly maintained remotes for curtains & lights. Jacuzzi switches which don’t work like they should. A wifi network that keeps rejecting your log-ins. TV channels set up for free-to-air broadcast of the World Cup but requiring a major reprogramming of channels (say, 30 minutes by the hotel's technician's estimate) to get back  pay-TV services for CNN, BBC etc although the flat-screen TVs had more than enough AV, HDMI, RF connectors for an easy flick of the switch, like my home TV has been set up to switch between free broadcast, pay-TV, Apple TV & other devices. 

So much for the UN-smart features in this SMART villas. 

Service was mediocre although the staff tried hard. Day 1 we had floor towels for tapping wet feet next to the shower, bath tub & toilet. Day 2 we were missing one towel. Day 3 was greeted with one miserable towel next to the bath tub. Similar neglects in other areas such as refills of your favourite tea bags — 6 tea bags on day 1 dwindling down to 2 bags on day 3.

Breakfast is another thorn. Always lukewarm; unappetising omelettes, dry-hard scrambled eggs, overcooked meat & sausages. Then there’s the issue of sauces & condiments. Best to buy your own ketchup, chill sauce, salt, pepper & whatever else you may need.

But the most crucial failing of it all was the thoughtlessness which went into the glasses and eating utensils which were all breakable. Start with storage — 6-inch tall champagne flutes stored vertically in 12-inch drawers which topple over, and may break, whenever that drawer is opened. 3-bedroom villas with private pools invite partying and families, yet all the drinking glasses, plates and bowls were all breakable. I can understand that “touch of class” C151 may have set out to portray for the prices they're charging; but surely — had common sense and pragmatism prevailed — the designers and vendors could be prodded into coming up with that “touch of class” while catering to partying and families with kids without fear of anyone tripping over that breakable glass or plate by the pool! Water, bare feet, broken glass etc. — they are all ingredients to a nightmare waiting to happen.
title: Grand old Dame in dire need of an overhaul

text:
C151 Villas are beautiful and breathtaking! Upon walking into our villa, we were awe struck as to how beautiful and trendy it is! 
But, there are little details which kept bugging me...for instance, in the master shower stall, water leaks out of the bottom of the shower stall - the wood floor is heavily water stained indicating that this has been an older/ongoing issue. 
Although the pool is stunning, water falls out the side and tends to gather in front of the living room doors and stays there...not draining anywhere, causing a wet mess ;-( 
We had to grab extra towels to put near there to dry it up and to prevent water from hitting the living room floor.
The kitchen/bathroom faucet handles and appliances show a lot of wear and tear which was surprising how more expensive this place is..
The in-house stereo receiver kept shorting out if you played music too loud...
One of the ceiling lights in the living room kept flickering on and off which was annoying....
But the service was amazing!

Although I loved this place, these little details and others I did not mention surprised and bugged me considering how upscale this place is/attempts to be. 
The location is great and the concept is amazing...I just wish the owners would keep the villas up with the image they are portraying....I would stay here again depending on asking price for that season!

text:
Stayed in C151 smart villa for 2 nights. Overall stay is comfortable, the villa is a modern one outfitted with LCD tv in every corner of the room, even in the toilet. text:
I was actually super excited on staying at C151 Seminyak after reading some of the wonderful reviews at Trip Advisor but turn out to be dissapointed at the hotel. We were on a holiday with a group of 9 pax and stay at the 3 bedroom villa and spend 6 days and 5 nights here.

I have spent the last 3 years spending NY celebration at seminyak area and trying out various luxury villas so i have a very clear benchmark on what to expect from these non chain hotels.

Location:
The hotel is conveniently located near all the "right" places, so if you want to go for a nice dinner or go to the beach it is within walking distance and even the hotel will provide shuttle to go to kudeta beach. 

Facilities:
The hotel actually has an interesting concept, it's modern and high tech which is kind of cool. Our three bedroom villa has jacuzzi, pool, automatic curtain, bose sound system and an interesting automatic toilet.

The issues were actually coming from the tiny details that were probably overlooked by the management as follows:

1. The sliding doors were difficult to be locked and definitely need to be serviced in some of the doors.

2. For a 3 bedroom villa, we were only given 1 key to get into our villa, and when i ask this to the staff, the response were a simple "yes sir we deliberately only giving out one key per villa because the keys are expensive".

3. Jacuzzi was clogged when we use it

4. Hairdryer didnt work and no one replace it up untill our departure from the hotel.

5. And some other maintenance issues (Villa auto door issue,etc)

Services:
There were a bit of issue of checking in (not the hotel's fault) because apparently the reservation is not made in our family member's name. 

In general the service hospitality was okay, all the staffs were polite and doing the right things for us. The real issue comes from the lack of system and working efficiencies rather than the politeness of the staffs.

One minor incident occured during the check in, the receptionist staff was asking us whether we are in the right C151 because apparently they also have hotel in dreamland area. In all my years in travelling domestically i have never experienced being addressed by the word (in Indonesian language) "kamu" when she was asking us whether we are in the right hotel location. The exact question was (in Indonesian language) "apakah kamu gak salah hotel?"(loosely translated into "are you sure that you're in the right hotel?"). This is rather suprising because in every hotel that i know in indonesia even the budget hotel they always address their guests by Bapak/Ibu (Sir/Mam). But that was a minor thing and we were fine with it.

The real issue would be on the lack of system. One simple evidence was us in the first day to ask for an extra blanket. It took us 5 follow up calls and 2 hours later until we have our extra blanket.

I am getting the sense that there were no solid coordination between the staffs, wrong menu being delivered on breakfast (when we were already put the breakfast forms as per instruction outside the villa), etc

If only the little things are being cared for, then this hotel would be a great place for a family holiday.

We just came back from a 1 week trip; where we spent 3 days in this villa. The views from the hotel are spectacular, staff where the most kind and warmhearted people I have met. The pool's really big and we had a blast spending our time in there. It's a little far from the busy areas in Bali, around a 40 minute drive to Kuta.

text:
I can't say enough good things about C151 Smart Villas in Seminyak.  Not only is the property centrally located to all of Seminyak's hot spots, the villas themselves are so beautiful that you don't want to leave!  The villa I stayed in (2 bedroom with media room) was was exquisitely appointed with the most high-end technology and the softest beds I have ever slept in!  The bathrooms were HUGE and amazing, with a giant soaking whirlpool tub and huge shower with rainfall shower head and adjustable handheld shower head.  The villa's pool space was beautiful, you could (and I did) spend all day there.  Be sure to order room service because the food is delicious and beautifully presented!

All in all, I cannot recommend this resort enough to you.  Treat yourself and stay here!

text:
Traveled in November of 2013 with two girlfriends, and had an absolutely amazing experience at C151. The villas are located in the heart of downtown Seminyak, a few minutes' walk from Ku De Ta, market or boutique shopping, and dining.

We stayed two nights in a three bedroom villa. The bedrooms are spacious and comfortable, and the bathrooms are gorgeous. The separate bedrooms with large common areas make the villas ideal for travel with large groups of friends and/or family. Spacious grounds and high privacy walls turn the villa into your own private paradise in the middle of Seminyak.

Although the accommodations themselves are incredible, the C151 staff take your holiday to a completely different level. Whether you're ordering room service, need directions, would like a reservation made, or simply have questions about Balinese culture, C151 staff respond to every request immediately and with a smile on their faces!

I will absolutely stay at C151 when I return to Bali, and recommend it to anyone looking for accommodations in Seminyak.
title: Villa paradise in the heart of Seminyak!

text: We stayed in a 3 bedroom villa. Location in Seminyak not bad, not directly next to a beach however. Villas themselves and pool are good size and layout. Bbq we had at the villa on the first night was very good. Overall however the stay was marred by a list of problems. Two toilets did not flush properly and we needed to get fixed. One bedroom phone had to be replaced. The pool filters or pump had a problem so after the first day a dirty film appeared on the surface which was never satisfactorily fixed hence we could not fully utilize the pool. In house dining apart from the bbq was v average. Breakfast coffee was initially just made from instant powder till I complained. A member of our group asked for a head spa and was sent someone who did not speak english and did not have a working hair dryer. The blinds on some of the windows in our bedroom did not fully block out sunlight hence would wake earlier than we ideally wished to. As if to underline the problems there was a blackout on our last night which lasted 30mins or so. A few years ago this villa was probably high tech but we had to ask for an ipod dock which should be standard. On checking in and checking out their machine could not read my card despite my having used it without problem on the previous day at other locations. There were no real apologies made for all the troubles nor any offer of compensation. If we had not already been late for our airport pickup due to the card difficulties I would have pushed for this but did not have time. They charged $48 for airport transfer, admittedly a large van but we got another quote from a cab driver of 150,000 IDR ie around $15 so a ripoff.
title: C151 Disappointing
